inclusion.criterion: premenopausal women over the age of 18 who have BV
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: willing to refrain from using any vaginal medications, douches or spermicides except for the metronidazole suppositories that are given to her for the duration of the study
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: willing to use supplied non-lubricated condoms when sexually active
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: subject to refrain from alcohol for 24 hours prior to the first 7 days of the metronidazole treatment and for 48 hours after completion of this treatment
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: premenopausal and have not experienced any vaginitis in the past year
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: willing to obtain daily samples and return monthly with the samples for a self-swab evaluation and a replenishment of the daily swab supplies
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: must be using some form of contraception if sexually active
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: mixed vaginal infection at time of enrollment
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: pregnancy, nursing or planning on getting pregnant
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: subject on anticoagulation therapy, lithium therapy or Antabuse therapy
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: vaginal bleeding at time of enrollment
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: The patient is a 25-year-old pregnant woman with symptoms of fever, chills, nausea, vomiting, dysuria, urgency and frequency. She has no history of recurrent UTI prior to her pregnancy or any other underlying disease.
